==Specifications==

===Construction and safety===
The Twizy is an ultra-compact vehicle, with a length of {{convert|2.32|m|ftin}}, a width of {{convert |1.19|m|ftin}} and a height of {{convert|1.46|m|ftin}}.

The vehicle's frame and body offer occupants extra protection with its deformable structure, while the outboard position of the four wheels and the lateral beams located either side of the chassis provide protection in case of a side impact. The safety retention systems include a driver's airbag, a four-point safety belt at the front and a three-point one at the rear.

===Models===
The Twizy model is [[electric]], and it therefore is part of Renault's [[Renault Z.E.|Zero Emissions programme.]]

[[File:Renault Twizy.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Twizy Technic – [[Vehicle door|doors]] are optional]]

====Twizy Urban====

=====Twizy Urban 45=====
The Twizy range starts with the [[Motorised quadricycle#Light quadricycles (L6e)|light quadricycle]]-classed '''Urban 45''' that is priced at {{Euro|6,990}} in Europe with a monthly battery lease charge of {{Euro|50}}.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/motoring/nissan-leaf-sales-begin-in-spain-2283110.html |title=Nissan Leaf sales begin in Spain|work=The Independent|date = 2011-05-12 |accessdate=2011-05-18}}</ref> It has a motor power of {{convert|4|kW|hp|0|abbr=on}}, a maximum speed of {{convert |45|km/h|mi/h|0| abbr =on}} and can thus be driven in most European countries by drivers from 14 years old with a special driving licence (France, Italy, Spain) or with a moped licence (Belgium, Germany, Netherlands, Austria, Finland).<ref>{{cite web|title=Renault Twizy will be launched over a year and will cost {{Euro |5,000}} |url= http://fantasticars.info/2010/02/13/renault-twizy-will-be-launched-over-a-year-and-will-cost-5000-euros/ |publisher=Fantasi Cars |accessdate=19 May 2011}}</ref>

=====Twizy Urban 80=====
The [[Motorised quadricycle#Heavy quadricycles (L7e)|heavy quadricycle]]-classed '''Urban 80''' model features a {{convert|13|kW|hp|0|abbr=on}} electric motor and can drive up to {{convert |80|km/h|mi/h|0| abbr=on}}. It is priced at {{Euro|7,690}}.

====Twizy Colour and Technic====
The '''Colour''' model is a colourful and 'fun' Twizy available for both the 45 and 80 trims.{{citation needed|date =July 2012}}

The '''Technic''' model brings additional design elements while sharing the technical features with the Urban. It is priced at {{Euro |8,490}}, and it is available for both the 45 and 80 trims.{{citation needed|date= July 2012}}

====Twizy Cargo====

In June 2013 Renault announced the introduction of the Twizy Cargo, a model designed for hauling goods. The space destined for the seat of the second passenger was replaced with a cargo box with a volume of {{convert|180|L|cuft|abbr=on}} and maximum weight capacity of {{convert|75|kg|abbr=on}}.<ref name=TCargo>{{cite web|url=http://insideevs.com/renault-unveils-twizy-cargo-electric-delivery-vehicle/|title=Renault Unveils Twizy Cargo Electric Delivery Vehicle |author=Mark Kane|publisher=InsideEVs.com |date=2013-06-24|accessdate=2013-06-26}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.avem.fr/actualite-twizy-cargo-renault-lance-une-version-utilitaire-du-twizy-pour-les-professionnels-4221.html|title=Twizy Cargo – Renault lance une version utilitaire du Twizy pour les professionnels|language=French|trans_title=Twizy Cargo - Renault launches a utility version of the Twizy for professionals |author=Michaël Torregrossa|publisher= Association pour l'Avenir du Véhicule Electrique Méditerranéen (AVEM)|date=2013-06-24|accessdate=2013-06-26}}</ref>

=====Twizy Cargo 45=====
The Cargo 45 has 4 [[kW]] of power and top speed is limited to {{convert|45|km/h|abbr=on}}. Pricing starts at {{euro|6,750}} ({{USD|8,839}}) plus [[VAT]] and the monthly battery lease fee that starts at  {{euro|50}} ({{USD|65.50}}).<ref name=TCargo/>
[[File:Nissan New Mobility Concept.jpg|thumb|The Nissan New Mobility Concept, a rebadged version of the Twizy, was deployed for the "Choimobi Yokohama" [[carsharing]] program in Japan in 2013.]]

=====Twizy Cargo 80=====
The Cargo 80 delivers a top speed of {{convert|80|km/h|abbr=on}}. Pricing starts at {{euro|7,350}}({{USD|9,625}}) plus [[VAT]] and the monthly battery lease fee that starts at  {{euro|50}} ({{USD|65.50}}).<ref name=TCargo/>

====Nissan NMC====

A rebadged version of the Twizy was launched in Japan as the '''Nissan New Mobility Concept''' (NMC). The electric vehicle was deployed in [[Yokohama]] on 11 October 2013 for service on a one-way [[carsharing]] program called "Choimobi Yokohama" (Choimobi means "easy mobility" in Japanese). During its first month on the market, over 2,700 customers sign-up for the service.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://green.autoblog.com/2013/09/27/nissan-new-mobility-concept-enters-carsharing-service-in-japan/|title=Nissan New Mobility Concept enters carsharing service in Japan|author=Danny King|publisher=[[Autoblog Green]]|date=2013-09-27|accessdate=2013-11-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.houseofjapan.com/auto-moto/more-than-2700-sign-up-in-first-month-of-choimobi-yokohama-car-sharing-service-using-nissan-new-mobility-concept-ultra-compact-ev|title=More than 2,700 sign up in first month of "Choimobi Yokohama" Car Sharing Service using NISSAN New Mobility CONCEPT Ultra-Compact EV|author= |publisher=House of Japan|date=2013-11-18|accessdate=2013-11-30}}</ref> A total of 45 units were registered through the end of October 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ev-sales.blogspot.ca/2013/11/japan-october-2013.html|title=Japan October 2013|author=Jose Pontes|publisher=EV Sales|date=2013-11-30|accessdate=2013-11-30}}</ref>

===Battery===
[[File:Twizy-IMG 6981.JPG|thumb|Twizy with charging wire out.]]
The {{convert|6.1|kWh|MJ|0|abbr=on}} [[lithium-ion battery]] is located underneath the front seat. Both motor variants carry the same weight of {{convert|474|kg|lb|0|abbr=on}},<ref>[http://www.renault.co.uk/cars/model/twizy/pricesandspecs.aspx]</ref> including batteries of {{convert |100|kg|lb|0| abbr =on}}. The [[Range (vehicle)|range]] is homologated at {{convert|100|km|mi|abbr=on}}. In real conditions, Renault announces around {{convert |80|km|mi|abbr=on}}. In worst conditions (high speed, no eco-driving), Twizy can reach {{convert|50|km|mi|abbr =on}}.

The battery can be charged with an extendable spiral cable stored beneath a flap at the front of the vehicle.
The integrated charger is compatible with roadside battery charging facilities as well as the standard 220&nbsp;V 10&nbsp;A household electrical supply. Charging an empty battery takes around three-and-a-half hours.

A planned Renault battery plant near Paris was delayed due to technical constraints. Construction will start in the second quarter of 2012 and production of batteries is expected to begin in 2014 or 2015. In the meantime Renault intends to buy batteries for its EV range from a joint venture between [[Nissan Motor]] and [[NEC]] as well as [[LG Chem]] of South Korea.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/06/15/renault-idUSLDE75E25S20110615 |title=Renault says battery plant project delayed |date=2011-06-15|first =Helen|last = Beresford|publisher=Reuters}}</ref>

Twizy is only supplied with LG Chem modules. Batteries are assembled in Renault Valladolid plant.

==Sales==
Since its market launch in March 2012, global sales reached 9,020 units through the end of 2012,<ref name=TwizySales2012>{{cite web|url=http://www.renault.com/fr/finance/chiffres-cles/pages/ventes-mensuelles.aspx |title=Ventes Mensuelles|language=French|trans_title=Monthly Sales|publisher =Renault |date=2013-01-18|accessdate= 2013-01-18}} Click on {{Citation|title = Ventes mensuelles |date=December 2012|format = XLS}}, 294 Ko to download, and open the TWIZY sheet.</ref> of which, 9,015 units were sold in Europe,<ref name = TwizySales2012/> making the Twizy the best-selling [[plug-in electric vehicle]] in the European market that year.<ref name= TopPEV2012>{{cite web|url=http://insideevs.com/video-twizy-twists-its-way-through-renaults-indoor-technocentre/|title= Video: Twizy Twists Its Way Through Renault’s Indoor Technocentre|author = Eric Loveday|publisher = InsideEVs.com| date = 2013-02-15 |accessdate=2013-06-21}}</ref> In France, a total 1,551 units were registered through June 2012, including 1,212 Twizy 80s and 339 Twizy 45s, representing a market share of 89% in the [[heavy quadricycle]] segment, and a market share of 28.5% among all categories of [[electric vehicle]]s sold in France during the first half of 2012, surpassing the [[Bollore Bluecar]], the top selling highway-capable all-electric car during this time period.<ref name= AVEM1S2012>{{cite web |url= http://www.avem.fr/actualite-vehicules-electriques-les-immatriculations-en-france-au-premier-semestre-2012-3306.html|title = Véhicules électriques – Les immatriculations en France au premier semestre 2012|language = French| trans_title = Electric Vehicles – Registrations in France in the first half of 2012 |publisher = Association pour l'Avenir du Véhicule Electrique Méditerranéen (AVEM)| date=2012-07-12|accessdate = 2012-07-18}}</ref>

Global sales fell 66.4% in 2013 from 2012, with 3,025 units delivered.<ref name=Renault2011_14/> Cumulative sales reached 14,160 units through October 2014.<ref name=Renault50K>{{cite web|url=http://insideevs.com/renault-electric-car-sales-quietly-surpass-50000/ |title=Renault Electric Car Sales Quietly Surpass 50,000|author=Mark Kane|publisher=InsideEVs.com|date=2014-11-22|accessdate=2014-11-29}}</ref> {{As of|2014|10}}, the best-selling markets are Germany with 3,728 units and France with 3,276 units, followed by Italy with 2,265 units, Spain with 1,292, and [[Benelux]] with 1,137 units delivered since 2011.<ref name=Renault2011_14>{{cite web|url=http://group.renault.com/finance/informations-financieres/chiffre-cles/ventes-mensuelles|
title=Ventes Mensuelles|language=French|trans_title=Monthly Sales|author=Groupe Renault|publisher=Renault.com|date=November 2014|accessdate=2014-11-29}} ''Click on "Ventes mensuelles du groupe (décembre 2011) (xls, 183 Ko)" "Ventes mensuelles (décembre 2012) (xls, 289 Ko)" - Ventes mensuelles (décembre 2013) (xlsx, 227 Ko)" - "Ventes mensuelles (octobre 2014) (XLSX - 219 Ko)" to download the files for 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 sales, and open the tab "Twizy Renault".''</ref>

==Carsharing program==
Renault tested a [[carsharing]] program called Twizy Way in [[Saint-Quentin-en-Yvelines]], France, beginning in late June 2012. During the testing phase the program operated with a fleet of 50 Renault Twizys distributed over a pilot area covering around {{convert|27|sqkm|sqmi|0|abbr=on}}, and around 200 were allowed to sign up for testing.<ref name=Release/> Twizy Way opened the service to the general public in December 2012.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.automobile-propre.com/breves/twizy-way-retours-experience-boutique/ |title=Twizy Way : retours d’expérience et ouverture d’une boutique|language=French|trans_title=Twizy Way: feedback and opening a boutique|author= |publisher=Automobile Propre|date=2012-12-04|accessdate=2012-12-19}}</ref>

==Chinese copy==
In September 2014 the Chinese company Zhejiang Litong New Energy Automobile Corporation launched the Rayttle E28. The E28 greatly resembles the Twizy in outside appearance, size and claimed performance.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Ning|first1=W.E.|title=Spotted in China: Rayttle E28 EV is not a Renault Twizy|url=http://www.carnewschina.com/2015/01/12/spotted-in-china-rayttle-e28-ev-is-not-a-renault-twizy/|accessdate=26 January 2015|publisher=Car News China|date=12 January 2015}}</ref>

==Popular culture==
In the music video of [[David Guetta]]'s song "Rest of my Life", a Twizy was shown in one of the scenes where it is seen in a tunnel, and it also appeared in David Guetta's video for the song "[[Play Hard]]". Several Twizys are featured in Guetta's music video of the song "[[The Alphabeat (song)|The Alphabeat]]". In it Guetta himself and the video's main characters drive Twizys. The cars are then charged by electricity generated by the dancing and jumping of the people attending Guetta's gig.

The '''Lamborghini Aventador''' is a [[Mid-engine design|mid-engined]] [[sports car]] produced by the Italian manufacturer [[Lamborghini]].

Launched on 28 February 2011 at the [[Geneva Motor Show]], five months after its initial unveiling in [[Sant'Agata Bolognese]], the vehicle, internally codenamed LB834, was designed to replace the ten-year-old [[Lamborghini Murciélago|Murciélago]] as the new flagship model.<ref>{{cite web|author=di Andrea Zuanni |url=http://www.motori.it/tecnica/6998/lamborghini-tutti-i-dettagli-e-i-video-del-nuovo-v12.html |title=Lamborghini: tutti i dettagli e i video del nuovo V12 – Tecnica|publisher=Motori.it |date=17 November 2010 |accessdate=21 July 2011}}</ref><ref name=autoblogindepth>{{cite web|url=http://www.autoblog.com/2011/02/28/2012-lamborghini-aventador-lp700-4-in-depth/ |title=2012 Lamborghini Aventador LP700-4: In Depth | publisher=Autoblog | date=28 February 2011 |accessdate=1 March 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.covercars.com/cars/36185|title=2012 Lamborghini LP700-4 Aventador|publisher=CoverCars|date=25 February 2011|accessdate=25 February 2011}}</ref>

Soon after the Aventador unveiling, Lamborghini announced that it had already sold over 12 of the production vehicles, with deliveries starting in the second half of 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.insideline.com/lamborghini/aventador/lamborghini-aventador-sold-out.html |title=Lamborghini Aventador Sold Out |publisher=Insideline.com |date=9 March 2011 |accessdate=21 July 2011}}</ref>

==Background==
The Aventador was designed by Italian designer Filippo Perini.{{citation needed|date=August 2014}} Similar to the earlier limited-edition [[Lamborghini Reventon]], its heavy use of sharp creases and planar surfaces are indicative of Lamborghini's contemporary styling direction which were directly inspired by the aircraft of the United States Military's Stealth Fighter Program,{{citation needed|date=August 2014}} namely the [[F-117A Nighthawk]] and the [[F-22 Raptor]].

In keeping with Lamborghini tradition, the Aventador is also named after a fighting bull. Aventador ({{IPA-es|aβentaˈðoɾ|pron}}) was a bull that fought particularly valiantly in the bull ring of [[Saragossa]], Spain in 1993.<ref>{{cite journal|last=Markus|first=Frank|title=Sant'Agata Bolognese to Zaragoza, the Heming-Way|journal=[[Motor Trend]]|date=February 2013|volume=65|issue=2|page=106|url=http://www.motortrend.com/features/travel/1202_search_of_lamborghini_aventador_death_in_the_afternoon/viewall.html}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Toros Notables|url=http://www.laplazareal.net/torosnotables33.htm|accessdate=6 July 2013|language=Spanish}}</ref>

==Aventador LP 700-4==
[[File:Lamborghini Aventador LP700-4 LB834.jpg|thumb|Lamborghini Aventador LP700-4, Geneva]]
Production will be limited to 4,000 units (4,099 [[Lamborghini Murciélago|Murciélago]]s were built). The [[Molding (process)|molds]] used to make the [[Carbon-fiber-reinforced polymer|carbon-fibre]] [[monocoque]] are expected to last 500 units each and only 8 have been made. The base price of the Aventador is {{USD|393,695}}.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.autocar.co.uk/News/NewsArticle.aspx?AR=255814 |title=Lambo set for 4000 Aventadors |author=|date=10 March 2011 |work= |publisher=autocar.co.uk |accessdate=31 March 2011}}</ref>

The car's shape also borrows heavily from Lamborghini's limited-edition [[Lamborghini Reventón|Reventón]] and their [[Lamborghini Estoque|Estoque]] concept car.

The vehicle was unveiled at [[Lummus Park, Miami Beach|Lummus Park]], Miami, followed by [[Miami International Airport]],<ref>{{cite press release |url=http://www.lamborghini.com/en/company/news/details/1/1/1/miami-calling/?cHash=bc150d2e56df01d2aea00dcb37a7320c |title=Miami Calling |publisher=Lamborghini |date=25 January 2013 |accessdate=13 December 2013}}</ref> followed by Auto China 2014 (with Nazionale configuration via Lamborghini Ad Personam personalization program).<ref>{{cite press release |url=http://www.autoblog.com/2014/04/20/lamborghini-aventador-nazionale-beijing-official/ |title= Lamborghini reveals Aventador Nazionale in Beijing |publisher=autoblog |date=20 April 2014 |accessdate=13 December 2013}}</ref>

Known internally as the ''L539'',<ref name=autoblogindepth/> the new engine is Lamborghini's fourth in-house engine and second V12. It is the first all-new V12 since the [[Lamborghini V12|3.5 litre powerplant]] found in the [[Lamborghini 350GT|350GT]].<ref>{{cite journal|last=Gritzinger|first=Bob|title=The Beatification of Lamborghini|journal=AutoWeek |date=30 May 2011|volume=61|issue=11|pages=20–23}}</ref>

Its transmission, a single-[[clutch]] seven-speed [[semi-automatic transmission|semi-automatic]], is built by [[Graziano Trasmissioni]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.autotechblog.org/lamborghini-aventadors-7-speedl-transmission-oerlikon-graziano |title=Lamborghini Aventador’s transmission comes from Italian specialists Oerlikon Graziano |author= |date= |work=Harry |publisher= |accessdate=31 March 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.oerlikon.com/ecomaXL/index.php?site=GRAZIANO_EN_press_releases_detail&udtx_id=8206 |title=Oerlikon Graziano and Vocis Driveline Controls develop step change in transmission technology for new Lamborghini flagship|author= |date=22 March 2011 |work= |publisher=Oerlikon Graziano |accessdate=31 March 2011}}</ref> Despite being single-clutch, gear-shifts are accomplished in 50 milliseconds.

The new, electronically controlled, [[all-wheel drive]] system is developed and supplied by the Swedish company [[Haldex Traction]], offering traction<ref>{{cite web|title=2012 Lamborghini aventador Lp700-4|url=http://www.topspeed.com/cars/lamborghini/2012-lamborghini-aventador-lp700-4-ar100112.html|publisher=Top Speed|accessdate=10 December 2012}}</ref> and handling capabilities based on their 4th generation technology.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.lamborghini.com/en/models/aventador/lp-700-4/technical-specifications/ |title=Aventador LP 700–4 Technical Specification |author=Lamborghini Automobili |date= |work= |publisher= |accessdate=13 October 2011}}</ref>

==Aventador LP 700-4 Roadster==
The 2013 Aventador LP 700-4 Roadster was announced for production on 27 December 2012, equipped with the same V12 engine as the coupé version, Lamborghini claims again that it can reach {{convert|100|km/h|mph|abbr=on}} in 2.9 seconds and a top speed equaling that of the coupe, at {{convert|349|km/h|mph|0|abbr=on}}.<ref>{{cite web|last=Sanchez|first=Edward A.|title=First Look:2013 Lamborghini Aventador LP 700-4 Roadster|url= http://www.motortrend.com/roadtests/exotic/1211_2013_lamborghini_aventador_lp_700_4_roadster_first_look/|publisher=Motor Trend|accessdate=25 December 2012}}</ref>

The removable roof consists of two [[carbon fiber]] panels, weighing {{convert|6|kg|lbs|abbr=on}} each, which required the reinforcement of the rear pillar to compensate for the loss of structural integrity as well as to accommodate the rollover protection and ventilations systems for the engine. The panels are of easy removal and are stored in the front luggage compartment. The Aventador Roadster has a unique engine cover design and an attachable wind deflector to improve cabin airflow at high speed as well as a gloss black finish in the A-pillars, windshield header, roof panels, and rear window area. The car has a {{USD|441,600}} base price. With a total weight of {{convert|1625|kg|lb|abbr=on}} it's only {{convert|50|kg|lb|abbr=on}} heavier than the coupé (the weight of the roof, plus additional stiffening in the sills and A-pillars).<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/motoring/car-manufacturers/lamborghini/9870441/Lamborghini-Aventador-LP-700-4-Roadster-review.html |title=Lamborghini Aventador LP 700-4 Roadster review |first=Paul |last=Hudson |work=Telegraph |location=UK |date=14 February 2013 |accessdate=20 October 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.autoblog.com/2012/11/15/lamborghini-aventador-lp-700-4-roadster-priced-from-441-600-for/ |title=Lamborghini Aventador LP 700-4 Roadster priced from $441,600 for US |first=Jeffrey N. |last=Ross |work=Autoblog |date=15 November 2012 |accessdate=20 October 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424127887324662404578330253825246818.html |title=2013 Lamborghini Aventador Roadster Review: For the Tall Driver in a Huge Hurry |first=Dan |last=Neil |work=WSJ.com |date=4 April 2013 |accessdate=20 October 2013}}</ref>

==Special editions==

===Aventador J===
[[File:2012-03-07 Motorshow Geneva 4614-edit.JPG|thumb|right|Lamborghini Aventador J]]
Six months after unveiling the Aventador, plans for a roadster version were leaked by the U.S. [[United States Environmental Protection Agency|EPA]] after it included the model on a data sheet on its website. Lamborghini officially unveiled the Aventador J to the world at the 2012 [[Geneva Motor Show]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.caradvice.com.au/161871/lamborghini-aventador-j-unveiled |title=Lamborghini Aventador J unveiled |publisher=Caradvice.com.au |year=2012 |accessdate=6 March 2012}}</ref> The roofless and windowless concept car uses the same V12 engine as the standard Aventador, producing 700&nbsp;hp through a lightweight seven-speed automated transmission. The car does not have air conditioning or radio to save further weight for a total of {{convert|3472|lb}}.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dieselstation.com/cars/lamborghini-aventador-j-2012-a4641.html|title=Lamborghini Aventador J 2012|publisher=DieselStation.com |date=14 March 2012 |accessdate=14 March 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.automoblog.net/2012/03/07/lamborghini-aventador-j-geneva-2012/ |title=Lamborghini Aventador J at Geneva 2012|publisher=Automoblog.net |date=7 March 2012 |accessdate=8 March 2012}}</ref> The car presented at the Geneva show was the only unit to be produced, and was sold for {{USD|2,800,000}}. Another Limited Edition model was made for Shaikh Al Yahyaa and was sold at an unknown price. The car was specially made for a close relation.<ref>{{cite web|first=Greg |last=Migliore |url= http://www.autoweek.com/article/20120306/GENEVA/120309907 |title=Lamborghini Aventador J sells for $2.8 million |publisher=Autoweek |date=6 March 2012 |accessdate=16 February 2013 }}</ref>

The J designation was thought to have come from Appendix J in the [[Fédération Internationale de l'Automobile|FIA]] rulebook that describes the technical specifications of race cars.<ref>{{cite journal |last=Migliore |first=Greg |title=Aventador J: Lamborghini goes topless at Geneva auto show |journal=Autoweek |date=5 March 2012 |url= http://www.autoweek.com/article/20120305/GENEVA/120309913 |accessdate=16 February 2013 }}</ref> However, during an interview with designer Filippo Perini, it was revealed that the 'J' actually stands for Jota, in reference to a 1970s one off Lamborghini [[Lamborghini_Miura#P400_Jota|Miura Jota]], which also conformed to the FIA's Appendix J regulations.

===Dreamliner Edition (2012)===
It is a version of Aventador LP 700-4 coupé with blue and white body colour scheme from [[Boeing 787 Dreamliner]], pitch-black wheels.

The vehicle was unveiled in 2012 Aerospace & Defense Supplier Summit.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.carbuzz.com/news/2012/3/14/Boeing-and-Lamborghini-Create-Aventador-Dreamliner-Edition-7707830 |title=Boeing and Lamborghini Create Aventador Dreamliner Edition |work=Car Buzz |date=14 March 2012 |accessdate=22 April 2013}}</ref>

===Aventador LP 720-4 50° Anniversario (2013)===
The Aventador LP 720-4 50° Anniversario is a limited (200 units - 100 Coupe and 100 Roadster) version of the Aventador LP 700-4 commemorating the 50th anniversary of Automobili Lamborghini. It included increased engine power to {{convert|720|PS|kW bhp|abbr=on}} via a new specific engine calibration, enlarged and extended front air intakes and the aerodynamic splitter, small flaps set into the sides, new rear end featuring an enlarged diffuser and expansive meshwork that further improves engine-compartment ventilation, model-exclusive Giallo Maggio (Italian for "May yellow") body colour featuring sparkling yellow paintwork with a layer of transparent and highly reflective particles; front and rear and sills in two-tone (Giallo Maggio and matte black) design, semi-aniline leather interior upholstery in Nero Ade (black) with Terra Emilia (optional Giallo Quercus (yellow)) with Q-Citura stitch diamond pattern, 50th anniversary emblem in forged composite carbon-fiber. The base price of the Aventador LP 720-4 50° is {{USD|548,000}} which is {{USD|106,300}} more than the Aventador Roadster.

The coupe was unveiled in 2013 [[Shanghai Motor Show]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://jalopnik.com/lambos-50th-anniversary-aventador-is-all-yellow-and-fa-475084602 |title=2014 LP 720-4 Announced |date=17 April 2013 |accessdate=17 April 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.autoblog.com/2013/04/20/2013-lamborghini-aventador-lp720-4-50-anniversario-shanghai-2013/ |title=2013 Lamborghini Aventador LP720-4 50 Anniversario is indeed worth celebrating - Autoblog |first=Jonathon |last=Ramsey |work=Auto Blog |date=20 April 2013 |accessdate=3 December 2013}}</ref>

The roadster was unveiled in 2013 Quail Motorsports Gathering.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.autoblog.com/2013/08/17/lamborghini-aventador-roadster-gallardo-monterey-2013/|title=Lamborghini unveils 50th anniversary Aventador Roadster and Gallardo|date=17 August 2013|work=Autoblog|accessdate=4 October 2014}}</ref>

===Aventador airport vehicle (2013)===
An Aventador was made for Bologna Airport with white body colour, red and white chequered flag decals on the sides, a light bar on the roof and 'FOLLOW ME' written on the hood.

The vehicle was unveiled in Bologna Airport between 6 May 2013 and 19 May 2013 and was used to guide aircraft around the airport.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.autoevolution.com/news/lamborghini-aventador-becomes-bologna-airport-vehicle-59181.html |title=Lamborghini Aventador Becomes Bologna Airport Vehicle |first=Andrei |last=Tutu |work=autoevolution |date=9 May 2013 |accessdate=31 July 2013}}</ref>
It was also used in Heathrow Airport, London, as an airport vehicle for a single day.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.topgear.com/uk/photos/Top-Gear-runs-Heathrow-2013-08-07 |title=Top Gear runs Heathrow Airport for a day |first=Dan |last=Read |website=Top Gear |date=24 October 2013}}</ref>

===Aventador Pirelli Edition (2014)===
The Lamborghini Aventador LP 700-4 Pirelli Edition was announced in December 2014. Celebrating a 50-year association between Lamborghini and Pirelli it features a design and color scheme that echoes the Pirelli tyre, with a thin red stripe running across the roof.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hrowen.co.uk/lamborghini/new-cars/aventador-pirelli-edition/ |title=Lamborghini Aventador Pirelli Edition |date=19 December 2014|work=HROwen|accessdate=27 February 2015}}</ref>

===Aventador LP 750-4 SuperVeloce (2015)===
[[File:2015-03-03 Geneva Motor Show 4145.JPG|thumb|2015 Lamborghini Aventador at the 2015 Geneva Motor Show]]
Lamborghini Aventador LP 750-4 Superveloce was announced in March 2015 at the Geneva Motor Show. Representing the essence of Lamborghini's brand it features an upgraded power train, with maximum horsepower increased to {{convert|750|bhp|kW|order=flip|abbr=on|0}} from the standard coupé's {{convert|700|bhp|kW|order=flip|abbr=on|0}}. Combined with weight reduction of {{convert|50|kg|lb|abbr=on|0}} from increased usage of carbon fiber both inside and outside the car the LP 750-4 SV boasts a power to weight ratio of 1&nbsp;hp to 2&nbsp;kg. The car also features increased aerodynamics, with downforce increased by 180% as compared to the standard Aventador coupé. Notable aerodynamic upgrades are a revised front splitter and rear diffuser, and a rear wing. The supercar is available in 34 base colors.<ref>[http://autoya.info/black_red_yellow_color_lamborghini_aventador_lp750_4_sv_configurator/photos/ Lamborghini Aventador LP 750-4 SV colors]</ref> The car's driving dynamics have also been upgraded, featuring new enhanced electronic steering for superior maneuverability at high speeds, magnetic pushrod suspension for superior handling, and chassis improvements to increase rigidity. Overall the LP 750-4 SV's standing {{convert|0|-|100|km/h|mph|abbr=on|0}} time is decreased from 2.9 seconds to 2.8 seconds, with the theoretical top speed still "somewhere in excess" of {{convert|217|mph|km/h|abbr=on|order=flip|0}}. Delivery of the car is scheduled to begin in the second quarter of 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.motorauthority.com/news/1097057_lamborghini-aventador-lp-750-4-superveloce-revealed-in-geneva-video|title=Lamborghini Aventador LP 750-4 SuperVeloce Revealed In Geneva: Video|author=Nelson Ireson|work=Motor Authority}}</ref>

===Aventador LP 750-4 SuperVeloce Roadster (2015)===
[[File:Lamborghini_SV_Roadster.jpg|thumb|right|2017 Lamborghini Aventador]]
Lamborghini Aventador LP 750-4 SuperVeloce Roadster was unveiled at the 2015 [[Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance]]. It features a compact two-piece carbon fiber hard top that can be stowed in the trunk like the previous roadster. Numerous weight-saving measures have lowered the Roadster’s weight to {{convert|3472|lb|kg|abbr=on|order=flip|0}}, a figure that makes it {{convert|110|lb|kg|abbr=on|order=flip|0}} lighter than the regular. In the US it comes with a base price of {{USD|530,075}} excluding tax. The delivery of the car is scheduled to begin in 2017. <ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.autoblog.com/2015/08/14/lamborghini-aventador-lp-570-4-superveloce-roadster-monterey-2015/#slide-3583463 |title=Lamborghini Aventador LP 750-4 SV Roadster drops its top at the Quail |first=Steven J. |last=Ewing |work=Autoblog |date=2015-08-14 |accessdate=2015-08-19}}</ref>

==Reception==
[[File:Lamborghini Aventador LP 700-4 chassis - Flickr - J.Smith831.jpg|thumb|Unibody construction as used for the Aventador LP700-4]]
Automotive magazines such as ''Car and Driver'' and ''Motor Trend'' reviewed the Aventador. ''Car and Driver'' titled their article "The best Lamborghini ever." ''Motor Trend'' described it as "the friendliest V-12 supercar in the world." Praise for Lamborghini's all-new V-12 powerplant centered on the engine's responsiveness, torque, and smooth power output. Criticism centered mainly around the Aventador's unrefined single-disc clutch.<ref>{{cite journal|first=Aaron |last=Robinson |url=http://www.caranddriver.com/reviews/2012-lamborghini-aventador-lp700-4-road-test-review-the-best-lamborghini-ever-page-2 |title=The Best Lamborghini Ever |publisher=Car and Driver |date=December 2011 |accessdate=16 February 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|last=Lago |first=Carlos |url=http://www.motortrend.com/roadtests/exotic/1201_2012_lamborghini_aventador_lp_700_4_test/ |title=2012 Lamborghini Aventador LP 700-4 European Spec First Test |publisher=Motor Trend |date=30 January 2012 |accessdate=16 February 2013}}</ref>

On 31 July 2011, the Aventador was reviewed by the motorsport show ''[[Top Gear (2002 TV series)|Top Gear]]''. Host [[Richard Hammond]] was impressed with the performance and handling of the car. His biggest complaint was a nostalgic poke at the Aventador's accessible temperament, implying that it left him longing for the "danger" associated with driving previous Lamborghini supercars.<ref>{{cite episode|title=Top Gear |series=Series 17|serieslink=Top Gear (series 17)|number=6|airdate=31 July 2011|network=BBC 2}}</ref> The Aventador posted the fifth<!--please see the talk page discussion before changing this to first--> fastest time ever recorded on the [[Top Gear test track]] with a time of 1:16.5, beating the {{USD|2,000,000}} [[Bugatti Veyron Super Sport]], the [[Enzo Ferrari (automobile)|Ferrari Enzo]], the [[Porsche 911 GT3]], and other supercars from around the world. In season 18 of the program, cohost Jeremy Clarkson said that the Aventador is better than the [[Ferrari 458 Italia]] (which they had previously called the best super car ever), describing it as being "£200,000 worth of dreams."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/topgear/show/powerlaps.shtml |title=Power Laps |publisher=BBC |date= |accessdate=16 February 2013}}</ref> The Aventador won the "Supercar of the Year 2011" from [[Top Gear (magazine)|Top Gear]].

==Marketing==
Robert Gülpen of RGE Robert Gülpen Engineering GmbH produced a 1/8-scale model Aventador LP 700-4 that was sold through an auction December 2011 with starting bid price of {{USD|4,700,000}} ({{euro|3,500,000}}).<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.autoblog.com/2011/09/17/lamborghini-aventador-1-8-scale-model-costs-12-times-the-real-th/ |title=Lamborghini Aventador 1:8 scale model costs 12 times the real thing |work=Autoblog |first=Jeremy |last=Korzeniewski |date=17 September 2011 |accessdate=12 October 2013}}</ref> A second model, featuring gold wrapping at body, was set to go for sale at auction with a starting bid price of {{USD|7,500,000}}.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.autoblog.com/2013/09/19/worlds-most-expensive-model-car-is-gold-sheet-lamborghini-video/ |title=World's most expensive model car will be wrapped in thin gold sheet |first=Damon |last=Lowney |work=Autoblog|date=19 September 2013 |accessdate=12 October 2013}}</ref>

BMC Switzerland produced a limited (50 units) edition of Lamborghini 50th Anniversary Edition impec bicycles inspired by the Lamborghini Aventador. The vehicle was sold for {{USD|32000}} ({{euro|25000}}) via international BMC or Lamborghini dealer network, with delivery done by the dealer.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.autoblog.com/2013/03/11/latest-ultra-light-lamborghini-only-costs-around-32-000/|title=Latest ultra-light Lamborghini only costs around $32,000|date=11 March 2013|work=Autoblog|accessdate=4 October 2014}}</ref>

The '''Lamborghini Veneno''' is a limited production [[supercar]] based on the Lamborghini Aventador and was built to celebrate Lamborghini’s 50th anniversary. At a price of {{USD|4,500,000}}, it is currently the most expensive production car in the world.<ref>{{cite web |first=Jim |last=Henry |title=10 Most Expensive Cars Of 2014: Keeping Up With The 1 Percent |url=http://www.forbes.com/sites/jimhenry/2013/12/19/10-most-expensive-cars-for-2014-keeping-up-with-the-joneses |work=Forbes |date=19 December 2013 |accessdate=1 July 2015}}</ref> The prototype, Car Zero, is finished in grey and includes an [[Italy|Italian]] flag vinyl on both sides of the car. The engine is a development of the Aventador's 6.5 L V12 and produces {{convert|750|PS|kW bhp|0|abbr=on}}.<ref>{{cite web |last=Tisshaw |first=Mark |title=Geneva motor show: Lamborghini Veneno |url=http://www.autocar.co.uk/car-news/geneva-motor-show-2013/geneva-motor-show-lamborghini-veneno |work=Autocar |accessdate=18 March 2013 |date=5 March 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite press release |url=http://www.lamborghini.com/en/company/news/details/1/1/1/a-unique-triple-pack-the-new-lamborghini-veneno/?cHash=3bcbb85cf6cab891e054a5ea8b856472 |title=A unique triple-pack: the new Lamborghini Veneno |publisher=Lamborghini |accessdate=3 December 2013}}</ref>

Lamborghini built just 5 examples of the Veneno: 2 for itself, and just three for customers. The first Veneno, with red accents, went to Antoine Dominic, owner of Lamborghini Long Island. The second went to Kris Singh, whose {{USD|4,000,000}} 750-hp masterpiece was delivered with green accents. Trimmed with white accents and completing the Italian Tricolore, the third model has been caught in Hong Kong en route to Macau where its new owner presumably resides. Car Zero, which was the vehicle on display,<ref name="topgearread">{{cite web |url=http://www.topgear.com/uk/car-news/lamborghini-veneno-geneva-motor-show-2013-03-04 |title=This is the Lamborghini Veneno |first=Dan |last=Read |work=topgear.com |date=4 March 2013 |accessdate=6 March 2013}}</ref> will be retained by the factory for the museum. The three production cars cost {{euro|3,120,000}} each, and all three were sold.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.trendzcar.com/2013-lamborghini-veneno.html |title=2013 Lamborghini Veneno |date=6 March 2013 |accessdate=20 March 2013}}</ref>

The vehicle number 0 was unveiled at the March 2013 [[Geneva Motor Show]],<ref name="autoblog.com">{{cite news |url=http://www.autoblog.com/2013/03/04/lamborghini-veneno-geneva-show-2013/ |title=Lamborghini Veneno finally, officially unveiled |first=Jeremy |last=Korzeniewski |work=autoblog |date=4 March 2013 |accessdate=8 August 2014}}</ref> followed by 2013 Quail Motorsports Gathering,<ref name="autoblog.com"/> Vallelunga circuit near Rome during the World Finals of Lamborghini Super Trofeo 2013 series.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.autoblog.com/2013/11/25/lamborghini-veneno-vallelunga-video/ |title=Lamborghini takes Veneno out to play on wet Vallelunga |first=Noah |last=Joseph |work=autoblog |date=25 November 2013 |accessdate=8 August 2014}}</ref>
There's another number 0 Veneno prototype test car.

===Veneno Roadster (2014)===
The '''Veneno Roadster''' is a limited (maximum 9 units during 2014) version of the Lamborghini Veneno, commemorating the 50th anniversary of Automobili Lamborghini. It has exclusive alloy wheels, Rosso Veneno (red) body colour and 2 bucket seats made in forged composite, woven carbon-fibre carbonSkin interior upholstery. The Veneno Roadster has a top speed of {{convert|221|mph|km/h|abbr=on|disp=flip}} and goes from {{convert|0|-|62|mph|km/h|abbr=on|disp=flip}} in 2.9 seconds.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.squaremile.com/precious-metal/10/bullissimo/ |title=Bullissimo! |work=Square Mile |date=26 September 2014 |accessdate=26 September 2014}}</ref>

The vehicle was unveiled on the Italian naval aircraft carrier [[Italian aircraft carrier Cavour (550)|Cavour]] docked in Abu Dhabi's [[Mina Zayed]] port,<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.autoblog.com/2013/12/03/lamborghini-veneno-roadster-aircraft-carrier/ |title=Lamborghini Veneno Roadster stands in for fighter jet aboard Italian carrier |first=Brandon |last=Turkus |work=autoblog |date=3 December 2013 |accessdate=8 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite press release |url=http://www.lamborghini.com/en/company/news/details/1/1/1/lamborghini-world-premiere-of-veneno-roadster/?cHash=6adac050495c2064fdd8685884ef8b5c |title=Lamborghini World Premiere of Veneno Roadster |publisher=Lamborghini |date=3 December 2013 |accessdate=8 August 2014}}</ref> followed by the 2014 Las Vegas [[Consumer Electronics Show]].<ref>{{cite press release |url=http://www.lamborghini.com/en/company/news/details/1/1/1/la-lamborghini-veneno-roadster-by-monster-debutta-al-ces/?cHash=e52e3f7999723ebcd8fb51666919b724 |title=Meet The Lamborghini Veneno Roadster at the CES 2014 in Las Vegas |publisher=Lamborghini |date=7 January 2014 |accessdate=8 August 2014}}</ref>

The roadster went on sale for {{euro|3,300,000}} (excluding tax).<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.autoblog.com/2013/10/20/lamborghini-veneno-roadster-official/ |title=Lamborghini officially reveals new Veneno Roadster |first= Noah |last=Joseph |work=autoblog |date=20 October 2013 |accessdate=8 August 2014}}</ref>
